revised_title: Bernard Lovell: A Life in Science and War
tldr: This book review recounts the life and achievements of Bernard Lovell, an astronomer who made significant contributions to radar technology during World War II and later pioneered radio astronomy. Lovell's work led to the development of the Jodrell Bank Observatory and the construction of its 250-foot steerable paraboloid telescope. The review highlights the importance of funding for scientific research and the role of remarkable individuals in advancing science.
